intro: Monechma pseudopatulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved monechma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This perennial herb typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. The plant features slender stems and small, ovate leaves with a distinctive reddish hue on the underside. Its flowers are greenish-white and are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences.
